title: Commit message guidelines
text: project adheres  following types: ci: Changes CI configuration files scripts docs: Documentation changes feat: new feature fix: bug fix refactor: code change neither fixes bug adds feature style: Changes affect meaning code (whitespace, formatting etc.) test: Adding missing tests correcting existing tests web: Changes website configuration files scripts misc: Changes, fit type (ignore lists, GitHub templates etc.)

title: Basic modelling workflow
text: Load package obtain copy demonstration project:
code: library(RPhosFate)  cv_dir <- demoProject()

title: Basic modelling workflow
text: Use RPhosFate() catchment() initialise project:
code: x <- RPhosFate(   cv_dir = cv_dir,   ns_dep_ovl = 25e-4,   ns_dep_cha = 0.0,   nv_tfc_inl = c(SS = 0.6, PP = 0.6),   nv_enr_rto = c(PP = 2.0),   nm_olc = matrix(c(4704255, 2795195), ncol = 2L),   df_cdt = read.table(     file.path(cv_dir, "cdt.txt"),     header = TRUE,     stringsAsFactors = FALSE   ) )

what: First model run for suspended solids (SS)
title: Basic modelling workflow
text: firstRun() calls low-level interface methods specified substance required order:
code: x <- firstRun(x, substance = "SS")

title: Basic modelling workflow
text: Snap coordinates provided calibration gauges respective midpoint nearest channel cell necessary check calibration quality:
code: x <- snapGauges(x)  metrics <- calibrationQuality(x, substance = "SS", col = "SS_load")

title: Basic modelling workflow
text: SS calibrated iteratively specifying better parameter values ns_dep_ovl (overland deposition rate) /ns_dep_cha (channel deposition rate) well calling subsequentRun() SS afterwards pleased metrics. default, subsequentRun() calls transport() low-level interface method specified substance: autoCalibrate() autoCalibrate2() methods may provide comfortable alternatives process.
code: x <- setParameter(x, ns_dep_ovl = 15e-4)  x <- subsequentRun(x, substance = "SS")  metrics <- calibrationQuality(x, substance = "SS", col = "SS_load")

title: Basic modelling workflow
text: First, call subsequentRun() PP necessary:
code: x <- subsequentRun(x, substance = "PP")  metrics <- calibrationQuality(x, substance = "PP", col = "PP_load")

title: Basic modelling workflow
text: procedure SS apart iteratively specifying better parameter values enrichment ratio: case substance interest PP, possible set enrichment ratio one directly calibrate via ns_dep_ovl /ns_dep_cha.
code: x <- setParameter(x, nv_enr_rto = c(PP = 1.4))  x <- subsequentRun(x, substance = "PP")  metrics <- calibrationQuality(x, substance = "PP", col = "PP_load")

title: Basic modelling workflow
text: Write parameters disk:
code: saveState(x)

what: Return to the calibrated project at a later time
title: Basic modelling workflow
text: Simply load previously saved state project via ls_ini argument RPhosFate() catchment():
code: x <- RPhosFate(   cv_dir = cv_dir,   ls_ini = TRUE )

title: Soil and Chemical Substance Emission and Transport Model
text: Install latest release CRAN: install.packages("RPhosFate")  Install development version GitHub (requires Rtools Windows remotes package): remotes::install_github("gisler/RPhosFate")

title: Soil and Chemical Substance Emission and Transport Model
text: Releases project versioned following rules SemVer.

title: DEM related input — DEMrelatedInput
text: Clips, pre-processes calculates determines input data related digital elevation model (DEM) broader sense: acc_inf, cha, dem, dir_inf, rds, slp_inf, wsh. Requires WhiteboxTools binary (whitebox::install_whitebox) installed computer.

title: DEM related input — DEMrelatedInput
code: DEMrelatedInput(   cv_dir,   cs_dem,   cs_cha,   sp_msk,   sp_olp,   sp_sds,   cs_rds = NULL,   ns_cha = NULL,   ns_brn = 50,   is_adj = 1L,   is_ths = 1L,   ls_mD8 = FALSE,   ls_tmp = FALSE )

title: DEM related input — DEMrelatedInput
text: cv_dir character vector specifying desired project root directory (first position). cs_dem character string specifying path potentially large raster digital elevation model. cs_cha character string specifying path potentially large raster providing channels. sp_msk terra::SpatVector providing somewhat oversized catchment polygon mask used clip potentially large input rasters processing. sp_olp terra::SpatVector providing desired catchment outlet point(s). sp_sds terra::SpatVector providing channel source points. cs_rds optional character string specifying path potentially large raster providing roads. ns_cha optional numeric scalar specifying minimum D8 flow accumulation number upslope grid cells determining channel. ns_brn numeric scalar specifying stream burning step size m. is_adj numeric scalar specifying many cells adjacent channels shall burnt. is_ths integer scalar specifying number threads use processing, applicable. ls_mD8 logical scalar specifying D8 flow directions shall mimicked, .e. D-infinity flow directions rounded nearest multiple 45 degrees. Please note treatment always applied channel cells independently argument. ls_tmp logical scalar specifying temporary files created computation shall kept.

title: DEM related input — DEMrelatedInput
text: two column numeric matrix specifying one catchment outlet coordinates side effects form raster files.

title: DEM related input — DEMrelatedInput
text: function applies following (pre-processing) steps ensure hydrologic consistency generated input data: Stream burning orientation cells adjacent channel cells approximately direction channel cells (effect ns_brn = 0). Depression breaching. Tracing downslope flowpaths provided channel sources. roads provided, considered flow obstacles breaking continuity calculated flow accumulations. ns_cha can used enhance channel network obtained tracing downslope flowpaths provided channel sources. dem represents breached DEM reversed stream burning applicable. basis calculation D-infinity slopes provided slp_inf, however, original DEM.

title: DEM related input — DEMrelatedInput
text: Lindsay, J.B., 2016. Efficient hybrid breaching-filling sink removal methods flow path enforcement digital elevation models. Hydrological Processes 30, 846–857. https://doi.org/10.1002/hyp.10648 Tarboton, D.G., 1997. new method determination flow directions upslope areas grid digital elevation models. Water Resour. Res. 33, 309–319. https://doi.org/10.1029/96WR03137

title: DEM related input — DEMrelatedInput
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # obtain temporary project root directory cv_dir <- normalizePath(   tempfile("cmt"),   winslash = .Platform$file.sep,   mustWork = FALSE ) # obtain directory holding "large" rasters and other required data sets cs_dir_lrg <- system.file("tinytest", "largeData", package = "RPhosFate")  nm_olc <- DEMrelatedInput(   cv_dir = cv_dir,   cs_dem = file.path(cs_dir_lrg, "dem_lrg.tif"),   cs_cha = file.path(cs_dir_lrg, "cha_lrg.tif"),   sp_msk = terra::vect(file.path(cs_dir_lrg, "msk.shp")),   sp_olp = terra::vect(file.path(cs_dir_lrg, "olp.shp")),   sp_sds = terra::vect(file.path(cs_dir_lrg, "sds.shp")),   cs_rds = file.path(cs_dir_lrg, "rds_lrg.tif"),   ls_tmp = TRUE )} # }

title: RPhosFate class — RPhosFate-class
text: S4 object representing river catchment.

title: RPhosFate class — RPhosFate-class
text: cv_dir character vector holding project root (first position) optionally Monte Carlo input data directory (second position). ls_ini logical scalar specifying state existing project loaded disk. is_ths integer scalar holding number threads use processing, applicable. is_MCi integer scalar holding current Monte Carlo iteration applicable. cv_MCl character vector holding names layers, shall written disk associated Monte Carlo iteration filenames upon calling appropriate methods. parameters S4 object holding model parameters. topo S4 object holding raster layers related topography broader sense. erosion S4 object holding raster layers related erosion. transport S4 object holding raster layers required modelling transport. substances S4 object holding substance raster layer containers. helpers S4 object holding helper data.

what: One dimensional automatic model calibration — autoCalibrate,RPhosFate-method
title: One dimensional automatic model calibration — autoCalibrate,RPhosFate-method
text: Automatically calibrates model help combination golden section search successive parabolic interpolation.

title: One dimensional automatic model calibration — autoCalibrate,RPhosFate-method
code: # S4 method for class 'RPhosFate' autoCalibrate(   x,   substance,   col,   interval,   metric,   tol = min(interval) * 0.1,   parameter = NULL )

title: One dimensional automatic model calibration — autoCalibrate,RPhosFate-method
text: x S4 RPhosFate river catchment object. substance character string specifying substance calculate. col character string specifying calibration data column respective substance river loads. interval numeric vector specifying end-points interval searched. metric character string specifying metric optimise. See calibrationQuality available metrics. tol numeric scalar specifying desired accuracy parameter used optimisation (metric). parameter default, SS calibrated utilising overland deposition rate substances calibrated utilising respective enrichment ratio. argument can used specify dedicated parameter utilised calibration via character string: "ns_dep_ovl" overland "ns_dep_cha" channel deposition rate.

title: One dimensional automatic model calibration — autoCalibrate,RPhosFate-method
text: S4 RPhosFate river catchment object side effects form raster files.

Calibration quality — calibrationQuality,RPhosFate-method
text: Assesses model's calibration quality help pairwise complete modelled well observed loads following metrics: NSE: Nash-Sutcliffe Efficiency mNSE: Modified Nash-Sutcliffe Efficiency (j = 1) KGE: Modified Kling-Gupta Efficiency RMSE: Root Mean Square Error PBIAS: Percent Bias RSR: Ratio RMSE standard deviation observations RCV: Ratio coefficients variation GMRAE: Geometric Mean Relative Absolute Error MdRAE: Median Relative Absolute Error addition, scatter plot observed river loads x- modelled river loads y-axis displayed provides visual impression model performance. elements plot identity line (solid) plus/minus 30% deviation lines (dashed).

title: Initialise project — RPhosFate
text: directory holds possible user input raster data (flow obstacles like roads must considered generation flow accumulation layer must also cut order properly respected): acc_inf: D-infinity flow accumulations number upslope grid cells required everything. CFa: (R)USLE C-factors required erosion. cha: Channel cells required everything (1: channel cell, NA: channel cell). clc: Clay contents top soils % required substance emissions. dem: Digital elevation model m .s.l. (optional). dir_inf: D-infinity flow directions azimuth degrees measured north (0 360 clockwise) required transportPrerequisites substance transport. fid: Field IDs (optional). KFa: (R)USLE K-factors required erosion. lue: Land use classes (optional). man: Manning's roughness coefficients required substance transport. xxc: Substance contents top soils mg/kg required substance emissions, example, ppc PP top soil contents. rds: Road cells required transportPrerequisites (0: road cell without subsurface drainage, 1: road cell subsurface drainage, NA: road cell). RFa: (R)USLE R-factors required erosion. slp_inf: D-infinity slopes % required everything. wsh: Watershed (optional).

title: Initialise project — RPhosFate
text: directory holds intermediate calculations: inl: Cells representing inlets roads (storm drains). LFa: L-factors. rip: Cells representing riparian zones within channel cells. SFa: RUSLE S-factors. slp_cap: Capped slopes %.

title: Initialise project — RPhosFate
text: directory holds model results: ero: Erosion t/cell/yr. xxe: Substance emissions kg/cell/yr, example, ppe PP emissions. xxr: Substance retentions t/cell/yr (SS) kg/cell/yr, example, ppr PP retentions. xxt: Substance transports t/cell/yr (SS) kg/cell/yr, example, ppt PP transports. xxt_cld: Substance cell loads t/cell/yr (SS) kg/cell/yr, example, ppt_cld PP cell loads. xxt_ctf: Substance cell transfers t/cell/yr (SS) kg/cell/yr, example, ppt_ctf PP transfers. xxt_inp: Substance inputs surface waters t/cell/yr (SS) kg/cell/yr, example, ppt_inp PP inputs surface waters. xxt_out: Substance outlet loads subsurface drainages t/cell/yr (SS) kg/cell/yr, example, ppt_out PP outlet loads.

title: Initialise project — RPhosFate
text: cv_dir: character vector specifying project root (first position) optionally Monte Carlo input data directory (second position). ls_ini: logical scalar specifying state existing project shall loaded disk (defaults FALSE). Parameters substance parameter values specified via ... argument take precedence loaded ones. is_ths: integer scalar holding number threads use processing (defaults 1). is_MCi: integer scalar specifying current Monte Carlo iteration applicable (defaults integer(), means Monte Carlo simulation mode disabled). cv_MCl: character vector specifying names layers, shall written disk associated Monte Carlo iteration filenames upon calling appropriate methods (defaults "xxt"; effect case Monte Carlo simulation mode disabled).

title: Initialise project — RPhosFate
text: ns_slp_min: numeric scalar specifying minimum bounding slope % (defaults 1.0). ns_slp_max: numeric scalar specifying maximum bounding slope % (defaults 999.0). ns_rhy_a: numeric scalar specifying network constant depending discharge frequency needed calculation hydraulic radius, turn prerequisite substance transport (defaults 0.09 representing discharge frequency approximately six years). ns_rhy_b: numeric scalar specifying geometry scaling exponent depending discharge frequency needed calculation hydraulic radius, turn prerequisite substance transport (defaults 0.50 representing discharge frequency approximately six years). ns_cha_rto: numeric scalar specifying ratio channel cell width determining widths riparian zones required substance transport (defaults 0.5). ns_man_rip: numeric scalar specifying Manning's roughness coefficient riparian zones within channel cells required substance transport (defaults 0.32). ns_man_cha: numeric scalar specifying Manning's roughness coefficient channel within channel cells required substance transport (defaults 0.04). ns_dep_ovl: numeric scalar specifying overland deposition rate per second required substance transport (calibration parameter; default). ns_dep_cha: numeric scalar specifying channel deposition rate per second required substance transport (calibration parameter; default). nv_tfc_inl: named numeric vector specifying inlet transfer coefficients required substance transport, example, c(SS = 0.6, PP = 0.6) (default). nv_enr_rto named numeric vector specifying substance enrichment ratios required substance except SS transport, example, c(PP = 2.0) (calibration parameter; default). nm_olc: two column numeric matrix specifying one catchment outlet coordinates required -channel retention ratio calibrationQuality (default). df_cdt: data.frame calibration data, must least following three columns one columns substance river loads t/yr (default): ID: ID(s) gauge(s) x: x-coordinate(s) gauge(s) y: y-coordinate(s) gauge(s)

title: Initialise project — RPhosFate
text: mode can make use repeated random samples, .e. raster data, distributions input data. filenames Monte Carlo input raster data must contain specified iteration, example, CFa12.tif twelfth iteration C-factors input data, can reside separate directory. case Monte Carlo raster file found certain layer designated directory, respective project root subdirectory searched one finally “normal” project input raster data utilised.

title: Initialise project — RPhosFate

title: Set parameter(s) — setParameter,RPhosFate-method
text: ns_slp_min: numeric scalar specifying minimum bounding slope % (defaults 1.0). ns_slp_max: numeric scalar specifying maximum bounding slope % (defaults 999.0). ns_rhy_a: numeric scalar specifying network constant depending discharge frequency needed calculation hydraulic radius, turn prerequisite substance transport (defaults 0.09 representing discharge frequency approximately six years). ns_rhy_b: numeric scalar specifying geometry scaling exponent depending discharge frequency needed calculation hydraulic radius, turn prerequisite substance transport (defaults 0.50 representing discharge frequency approximately six years). ns_cha_rto: numeric scalar specifying ratio channel cell width determining widths riparian zones required substance transport (defaults 0.5). ns_man_rip: numeric scalar specifying Manning's roughness coefficient riparian zones within channel cells required substance transport (defaults 0.32). ns_man_cha: numeric scalar specifying Manning's roughness coefficient channel within channel cells required substance transport (defaults 0.04). ns_dep_ovl: numeric scalar specifying overland deposition rate per second required substance transport (calibration parameter; default). ns_dep_cha: numeric scalar specifying channel deposition rate per second required substance transport (calibration parameter; default). nv_tfc_inl: named numeric vector specifying inlet transfer coefficients required substance transport, example, c(SS = 0.6, PP = 0.6) (default). nv_enr_rto named numeric vector specifying substance enrichment ratios required substance except SS transport, example, c(PP = 2.0) (calibration parameter; default). nm_olc: two column numeric matrix specifying one catchment outlet coordinates required -channel retention ratio calibrationQuality (default). df_cdt: data.frame calibration data, must least following three columns one columns substance river loads t/yr (default): ID: ID(s) gauge(s) x: x-coordinate(s) gauge(s) y: y-coordinate(s) gauge(s)

title: RPhosFate v2.0.1.9000
text: Updated package’s pkgdown website Bootstrap 5. Minor internal code improvements, require R ≥ 4.0.0.

title: RPhosFate v2.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-03-22 version introduces new flow method, also comes several breaking changes.

title: RPhosFate v2.0.1
text: Use D-infinity (Tarboton, 1997) instead D8 flow method, however, D8 flow method can still mimicked rounding D-infinity flow directions nearest multiple 45 degrees. Weighted flow accumulations longer supported time . basis calculation D-infinity slopes original digital elevation model breached one reversed stream burning used calculation D8 slopes. default value parameter holding minimum bounding slope (ns_slp_min) now 1 instead 0.001%. L factor now calculated using equation (9) published Desmet Govers (1996) modified Kovacs (2013). channel retentions substance outlet loads subsurface drainages now calculated analogous overland retentions local emissions, .e. using half respective flow path length. RPhosFate now utilises terra instead raster package. Ceased support ERDAS IMAGINE (*.img) raster files added img2tif() function, can used convert ERDAS IMAGINE raster files directory subdirectories GeoTIFF raster files. Dropped backward compatibility major version zero.

title: RPhosFate v2.0.1
text: Removed layers holding (weighted) D8 flow accumulations (acc acc_wtd) added acc_inf holding D-infinity flow accumulations. Removed layer holding D8 flow directions (dir) added dir_inf holding D-infinity flow directions. Removed layer holding D8 slopes (slp) added slp_inf holding D-infinity slopes. Considerable adjustments reflect aforementioned input data changes. Addition ns_cha argument: allows specifying minimum D8 flow accumulation determining channel. Addition ls_mD8 argument: allows mimicking D8 flow directions rounding D-infinity flow directions nearest multiple 45 degrees. Please note treatment always applied channel cells independently argument. Removal cs_wgs cs_dir arguments: input data longer supported time . Switched utilising SpatRaster SpatVector classes terra package instead RasterLayer class raster Spatial*DataFrame classes sp packages. Added is_ths argument RPhosFate() catchment() constructors: allows specifying number threads use processing, applicable. Removed layer holding hydraulic radii (rhy), calculation hydraulic radii now integrated transport() method. implies transportPrerequisites() method save result disk longer. Removed parameter holding D8 outflow direction vector (iv_fDo). Existing parameter files containing can still used, parameter definitely lost upon saving project’s state. Removed transportCalcOrder() method, determination cell transport calculation order now integrated transport() method. implies firstRun() well subsequentRun() methods call saveState() method save disk longer. calibrationQuality() method now returns return value invisibly. Considerably revised internal RPhosFateHelpers class. Removed spatstat.geom imported packages list (utilised functionality now also provided terra). Bumped minimum tested R version 4.2.3 4.3.2 using corresponding Posit public package manager snapshot. Slightly improved documentation. Major internal code improvements.

title: RPhosFate v1.0.4
text: CRAN release: 2023-10-07 Removed hydroGOF imported packages list (maptools retiring hydroGOF depends via hydroTSM). Thanks Roger Bivand raising issue (#17). Bumped minimum tested R version 4.2.2 4.2.3 using corresponding Posit public package manager snapshot. Slightly improved documentation.

title: RPhosFate v1.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-03-06 Removed rgdal suggested packages list set minimum required version raster package ≥ 3.6.3 (rgdal retiring raster ≥ 3.6.3 depend longer). Thanks Roger Bivand raising issue (#17). Bumped minimum tested R version 4.1.2 4.2.2 using corresponding MRAN repository snapshot. Slightly improved documentation. Minor internal code improvements.

title: RPhosFate v1.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-09-21 Removed NRMSE calibration quality metrics added KGE well RCV.

title: RPhosFate v0.12.0
text: Added autoCalibrate2() method: allows calibrating overland channel deposition rate one go. DEMrelatedInput() function can handle multiple catchment outlets now calibrationQuality() method. DEMrelatedInput() function now returns breached DEM reversed stream burning applicable instead original one. DEMrelatedInput() function now calculates “correct” slopes even channels used stream burning contain gaps. RPhosFate now makes sure x- y-coordinates gauges used calibration lie within extent river catchment object. Renamed "inChannelRetention" output calibrationQuality() method "inChannelRetentionRatio". RPhosFate requires R ≥ 3.5.0 now. Improved documentation.

title: RPhosFate v0.11.0
text: Monte Carlo simulation mode can now make use repeated random samples, .e. raster data, distributions input data. erosionPrerequisites erosion emission transportPrerequisites transportCalcOrder Added cv_MCl argument RPhosFate() catchment() constructors: allows specifying names layers, shall written disk associated Monte Carlo iteration filenames upon calling appropriate methods. Initialising project Monte Carlo simulation mode now also reads model results produced possible earlier run associated specified iteration. implies Monte Carlo input data additionally can reside project root subdirectories separate directory. plot produced calibrationQuality() method now prettier. Added vignette describing basic modelling workflow. RPhosFate now depends spatstat.geom instead spatstat package. Fixed minimum required version whitebox package (≥ 2.0.0). Added test standard use case DEMrelatedInput() function. Slightly improved documentation.

title: RPhosFate v0.10.0
text: DEMrelatedInput() function now calculates slopes breached DEM (stream burning undone beforehand). Switched utilising GeoTIFF (*.tif) instead ERDAS IMAGINE (*.img) raster files. Added cs_fex argument DEMrelatedInput() function: allows using ERDAS IMAGINE raster files backward compatibility. Added cs_dir argument DEMrelatedInput() function: allows utilising existing D8 flow directions raster using ArcGIS codes. Added demoProject() function providing training data. Added examples documentation. Fixed backward incompatibility. Added tests utilising unit testing framework tinytest package. Added means measure code coverage help covr.
